AgentCustomStatus.description:
The "custom_status" attribute represent the custom "away" status selected, it can either be:
* 1. null — ​The agent is available or in the generic "Away" status
2. { "id":"5582b1f4776562af9b000008" } — ​The id of the custom status

body_input_format.description: values can be: text or html.

category_ids.description: are content categories if none, they are default to intervention categories or thread categories

context_data.description: is present only if the content has context_data associated. The context_data hash keys are the custom fields keys.

url.description: You can download the attachments by using an API access token with the following URL: https://[your-domain].engagement.dimelo.com/attachments/[attachment_id]?access_token=[your_​ access_token]

ContentBodyFormatted.description: always contains text a​nd​ html versions.

EventExtraInfo.description: attributes in extra_infos are optional and unspecified/not guaranteed, don’t rely on it for critical tasks, this is provided as information only

identity_group_id.description: The identity group id references the identity group that contains all informations (phone, notes, etc.). Many identities may belong to this group. If the identity group id is null, it means that identity does not have a group and any extra information. Please refer to identity groups API for more informations.

color.description: Color of the icon: Default: 0 Blue: 1 Green: 2 Turquoise: 3 Purple: 4 Yellow: 5 Orange: 6 Red: 7 Asphalt: 8 Grey: 9

intervention_messages_boost.description: Priority boost of messages with intervention

post.description:
This method creates a new team. In case of success it renders the created tag, otherwise, it renders an error (422 HTTP code).

Note: The fields ​`mandatory`,​ `​multiple`,​ ​`post_qualification​`, `s​ource_ids`​ and `u​nselectable​` are accounted for only if the Category has no parent.

Authorization​: only users that can manage teams.

parameters.description: root category is unselectable (Boolean).

get.description:
This method renders threads ordered by last content date (descending). Only threads in sources where token’s user has “read” permission are returned.

Authorization​: no.

parameters.description: A search query to filter threads. Please refer to ​Search & filtering parameters​ for more details.
parameters.name: q

parameters.description: The record index to start. Default value is 0.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The max number of records to return. Default value is 30, max value is 150.
parameters.name: limit

get.description:
This method renders a thread from given id. If token’s user does not have “read” on thread’s source a 404 HTTP response will be returned.

Authorization​: no.
get.summary: Getting a thread from its id

put.description:
Thread closure/opening is only available for the following sources:
* Emails
* Answers
* Ideas
* Facebook Messenger
* Google+
* Lithium
* Mobile Messaging

Starts a job to close a thread. It returns the thread but as the job is asynchronous, the state of the “close” attribute in the returned object do not is the one when the job started.

If token’s user does not have “read” on thread’s source a 404 HTTP response will be returned. Returns a 403 if the thread cannot be closed or if the user does not have the permission to close a thread.

Authorization​: no.

Archives the contents of a thread. If token’s user does not have “read” on thread’s source a 404 HTTP response will be returned.

If the thread is already being archived, a 409 HTTP response will be returned.

Authorization​: no.

get.description:
Thread closure/opening is only available for the following sources:

* Emails
* Answers
* Ideas
* Facebook Messenger
* Google+
* Lithium
* Mobile Messaging

Starts a job to open a thread. It returns the thread but as the job is asynchronous, the state of the “close” attribute in the returned object is the one when the job started.

If token’s user does not have “read” on thread’s source a 404 HTTP response will be returned. Returns a 403 if the thread cannot be opened or if the user does not have the permission to open a thread.

Authorization​: no.

put.description:
This method updates the categories of a thread. If token’s user does not have “read” on thread’s source a 404 HTTP response will be returned.

If the thread is already being categorized, a 409 HTTP response will be returned.

Authorization​: no.

parameters.description: An array containing the new categories to set on the thread.
parameters.name: thread_category_ids[]

get.description:
This method renders contents ordered by creation date (descending). Only contents in sources where token’s user has “read” permission are returned.

Authorization​: no.

parameters.description: To filter contents on given query. Query works exactly like threads query but only have those keywords: intervention,identity, identity_group, source, status_in, thread or text. Order can be created_at.desc (default) or created_at.asc. e.g. q=intervention:"7f946431b6eebffafae642cc"%20source:"d19c81948c137d86dac77216" Please refer to ​Search & filtering parameters​ for more details.
parameters.name: q

parameters.description: The record index to start. Default value is 0.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The max number of records to return. Default value is 30, max value is 150.
parameters.name: limit

post.description:
This method allows you to create an new content. It can be a reply to another content or a content that initiate discussion. It use token’s user as content user if he is authorized. Content will be created in Dimelo Digital and pushed asynchronously to the source.

Replying to a customer content is usually possible (unless the source/conversation is read only).

Composing a content on the contrary depend on the source itself:
* The source may not support it (and be purely reactive like Instagram, Messenger ...)
* Some sources (usually public account) like Twitter or Facebook page allows to publish content without targeting specific individuals.
* Some sources (usually non public media) require specific targeting (phone number for SMS, email address for email, customer_id ...) to be able to create a content. This is source specific and detailed under the generic parameters.

Authorization​: only users that can reply or initiate discussion (= compose) on given source. it renders also an error if in_reply_to isn’t synchronized or if in_reply_to content is not under an ​open intervention.

parameters.description: The identity id of content. This parameter is not mandatory, by default it use the token’s user first identity on source.
parameters.name: author_id

parameters.description: The content’s body. This parameter is mandatory.
parameters.name: body

parameters.description: The content’s id you want to reply to. If omitted, a new discussion will be created. If source does not support to initiate discussion this parameter is mandatory.
parameters.name: in_reply_to_id

parameters.description: Created contents are public by default, set this parameter to "1" in order to create a private reply. It is NOT supported on every source.
parameters.name: private

parameters.description: The source to create content to. If you specify `in_reply_to_id` parameter, source will be determined from it. Otherwise, this parameter is mandatory.
parameters.name: source_id

parameters.description: An array containing the attachments’ ids that need to be attached to this content.
parameters.name: attachment_ids[]

parameters.description: For an email source. The subject of the email. This parameter is mandatory when initiating a discussion.
parameters.name: title

parameters.description: For an email or SMS source. For an email, an array containing the email addresses used in the “To” section of the email. This parameter is mandatory when initiating a discussion. For a SMS, the number the SMS will be sent to. It must start with 00 or +, example: +33634231224 or 0033634231224. This parameter is mandatory when initiating a discussion.
parameters.name: to[]

parameters.description: For an email source. An array containing the email addresses used in the “Cc” section of the email.
parameters.name: cc[]

parameters.description: For an email source. An array containing the email addresses used in the “Bcc” section of the email.
parameters.name: bcc[]

get.description:
This method renders a content from given id. If token’s user does not have “read” on content’s source a 404 HTTP response will be returned.

Authorization​: no.
get.summary: Getting a content from its id

put.description:
Ignores a content. If token’s user does not have “read” on content’s source a 404 HTTP response will be returned.

Authorization​: no.

This method updates the categories of a content. If token’s user does not have “read” on this content’s source a 404 HTTP response will be returned.

Authorization​: no.

parameters.description: An array containing the new categories to set on the content.
parameters.name: category_ids[]

Authorization​: only users that can create custom fields.

parameters.description: The associated type of custom field. It can be IdentityGroup or Intervention.
parameters.name: associated_type_name

parameters.description: The label of the custom field.
parameters.name: label

parameters.description: The key of the custom field (example: customer_id). This is used to determine how it is stored on identity groups.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description: The type of the custom field. It can be string, boolean, text, integer, float, single_choice,
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: A list of choices to be for single_choice, or multiple_choice types. This must be given
parameters.name: choices

parameters.description: true or false, this as no effect on single_choice, multiple_choice or boolean types
parameters.name: multiple

parameters.description: an integer that indicates custom field’s position between others (default: -1).
parameters.name: position

get.description:
This method renders events ordered by creation date (descending).

Authorization​: Only users whose role can search event permission.

parameters.description:
To filter events on given query. Query works exactly like threads query but only have those keywords: content, content_thread, name_in, created_before, created_after, user. Order can be created_at.desc (default) or created_at.asc. e.g. q=name_in:"content.replied"%20content_thread:"7f946431b6eebffafae642cc"%20created_after:"2014-03-20"%20user:"4ee91f197aa58d01b500000f"%20order:"created_at.asc"
* DateTime parameters should be ISO-8601
* you can specify multiple value for a given keyword: q=name_in:’content.replied’&name_in:’content.ignored’
Please refer to ​Search & filtering parameters​ for more details.
parameters.name: q

parameters.description: The record index to start. Default value is 0.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The max number of records to return. Default value is 30, max value is 150.
parameters.name: limit

get.description:
This method renders an event from given id. If token’s user role does not have “search event” permission a 404 HTTP response will be returned.

Authorization​: Only users who’s role can search event permission.
get.summary: Getting an event from its id

post.description:
This method creates a new intervention or reopen it. In case of success it renders the intervention, otherwise, it renders an error (422 HTTP code). This method opens intervention as access token’s user.

Authorization​: no, but it renders an error if intervention can’t be created or reopened (already opened, etc.).

parameters.description: The content to create intervention on (mandatory).
parameters.name: content_id

get.description:
This method renders an intervention from given id. If token’s user does not have “read” on intervention’s source a 404 HTTP response will be returned.

Authorization​: no.
get.summary: Getting an intervention from its id

delete.description:
This method cancels (destroys) an intervention. It renders intervention itself. If token’s user does not have “read” on intervention’s source a 404 HTTP response will be returned.

Caveats:

* If the intervention is already being canceled, it will return a 409 error.
* To be able to close an intervention, it must meet the following criteria otherwise a 403 will be raised:
  * Intervention MUST NOT already be closed
 * Intervention MUST NOT have agent replies
  * Access-Token agent MUST have read access on the source

Authorization​: no, but it renders an error if intervention can’t be destroyed (see caveats).

put.description:
This method closes an intervention. Caveats:

* If the intervention is already being closed, it will return a 409 error.
* To be able to close an intervention, it must meet the following criteria otherwise a 403 will be raised:

  * Intervention MUST NOT already be closed

  * Intervention MUST have agent replies
  * Access-Token agent MUST be the owner of the intervention or have the permission to edit permissions

  * Access-Token agent MUST have read access on the source

Authorization​: no, but it renders an error if intervention can’t be closed (see caveats)

409.description: If the intervention is already being closed, it will return a 409 error.

put.description:
This method updates the user in charge of the intervention

Authorization​: Only users who can update interventions.

This method updates the categories of an intervention. If token’s user does not have “read” on the intervention’s source a 404 HTTP response will be returned.

Authorization​: no.

get.summary: Getting a reply assistant entry from its id

put.description:
This method updates an existing entry from given attributes and renders it in case of success.

Authorization​: only users that have the right to manage reply assistant.

parameters.description: The name of the entry.
parameters.name: label

parameters.description: The internal/company id of the entry. This is used to match Engage Digital entry’s id with the company one. Example: KB042.
parameters.name: foreign_id

parameters.description: To restrict the entry to a set of Engage Digital categories. Then, KB entries that do not match message’s categories to which you are replying will not be suggested.
parameters.name: category_ids[]

parameters.description: entry shortcuts
parameters.name: shortcuts[]

parameters.description: Entry group id.
parameters.name: entry_group_id

parameters.description: Source ids (array)
parameters.name: source_ids[]

get.description:
This method renders all groups ordered by creation date (ascending).

Authorization​: only users that have the right to manage reply assistant.

parameters.description: The record index to start. Default value is 0.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The max number of records to return. Default value is 30, max value is 150.
parameters.name: limit

post.description:
This method creates an entry group. In case of success it renders the group, otherwise, it renders an error (422 HTTP code).

Authorization​: only users that have the right to manage reply assistant.

parameters.description: The name of the group.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: List of the reply assistant entries in this group.
parameters.name: entry_ids[]

parameters.description: Used for autocompletion in chat.
parameters.name: autocomplete

parameters.description: Used to determine the order of the groups in the interface, in ascending order.
parameters.name: position

delete.description:
This method destroys an existing group. It renders the group itself. It renders a 404 if id is invalid.

Authorization​: only users that have the right to manage reply assistant.

get.description:
This method renders an entry group from given id.

Authorization​: only users that have the right to manage reply assistant.
get.summary: Getting a reply assistant group from its id

put.description:
This method updates an existing group from given attributes and renders it in case of success.

Authorization​: only users that have the right to manage reply assistant.

parameters.description: The name of the group.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: List of the reply assistant entries in this group.
parameters.name: entry_ids[]

parameters.description: Used for autocompletion in chat.
parameters.name: autocomplete

parameters.description: Used to determine the order of the groups in the interface, in ascending order.
parameters.name: position

get.description:
This method renders all reply assistant versions ordered by creation date (ascending).

Authorization​: only users that have the right to manage reply assistant.

parameters.description: The record index to start. Default value is 0.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The max number of records to return. Default value is 30, max value is 150.
parameters.name: limit

post.description:
This method creates a reply assistant version. In case of success it renders the version, otherwise, it renders an error (422 HTTP code, 404 if the entry_id is invalid).

Authorization​: only users that have the right to manage reply assistant.

parameters.description: Body of the version
parameters.name: body

parameters.description: Reply assistant entry id (mandatory)
parameters.name: entry_id

parameters.description: Source ids (array)
parameters.name: source_ids

parameters.description: Either “text” or “html”
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: Language (ex: “fr”)
parameters.name: language

delete.description:
This method destroys an existing version. It renders the version itself. It renders a 404 if id is invalid.

Authorization​: only users that have the right to manage reply assistant.

get.description:
This method renders a version from given id.

Authorization​: only users that have the right to manage reply assistant.
get.summary: Getting a reply assistant version from its id

put.description:
This method updates an existing version from given attributes and renders it in case of success.

Authorization​: only users that have the right to manage reply assistant.

parameters.description: Body of the version
parameters.name: body

parameters.description: Reply assistant entry id.
parameters.name: entry_id

parameters.description: Source ids (array)
parameters.name: source_ids[]

parameters.description: Either “text” or “html”
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: Language (ex: “fr”)
parameters.name: language

get.description: This method renders roles ordered by creation date (ascending).

parameters.description: The record index to start. Default value is 0.

parameters.description: The max number of records to return. Default value is 30, max value is 150.

post.description: This method creates a new role. In case of success it renders the created role, otherwise, it renders an error (422 HTTP code).

parameters.description: permission only available with the corresponding extension enabled

parameters.description: permission only available with the corresponding extension enabled
parameters.name: manage_reply_assistant

parameters.description: permission only available with the corresponding extension enabled

parameters.description: permission only available with the corresponding extension enabled

parameters.description: permission only available with the corresponding extension enabled

parameters.description: permission only available with the corresponding extension enabled
parameters.name: reply_with_assistant

get.description:
This method renders a role from given id.

Authorization​: only users that can manage roles.
get.summary: Getting a role from its id

put.description:
This method updates an existing role from given attributes and renders it in case of success.

Authorization​: A user can’t update roles with more permissions than himself and can’t give a role a permission he doesn’t have.

Any permission updated with a user that does not have this permission will be ignored (The update is done, just not the unallowed permission)

parameters.description: permission only available with the corresponding extension enabled
parameters.name: manage_automatic_exports_tasks

parameters.description: permission only available with the corresponding extension enabled

get.description:
This method renders all settings of your domain.

Authorization​: only users that can update settings.

put.description:
This method updates the current domain settings.

Authorization​: only users that can update settings.

parameters.description: (in hours).
parameters.name: activity_presence_threshold

parameters.description: ​Enable activity tracking (Boolean)
parameters.name: activity_tracking

parameters.description: (Day of week)
parameters.name: beginning_of_week

parameters.description: A​ ctivate the forced categorization by source.​ (Boolean)
parameters.name: category_tagging

parameters.description: (See format)
parameters.name: content_languages

parameters.description: Activate the dashboard (Boolean)
parameters.name: dashboard

parameters.description: Prevent the DD to be embed by other websites (Boolean)
parameters.name: deny_iframe_integration

parameters.description: (Boolean)
parameters.name: disable_password_autocomplete

parameters.description: password expiration delay (in seconds)
parameters.name: expire_password_after

parameters.description: enable password expiration (Boolean)
parameters.name: expire_password_enabled

parameters.description: provide durations in seconds in export (Boolean)
parameters.name: export_in_seconds

parameters.description: fold archived contents (Boolean)
parameters.name: fold_useless_contents

parameters.description: FTE data period (in hours)
parameters.name: fte_duration

parameters.description: enable identity merge (Boolean)
parameters.name: identity_merge

parameters.description: (Array of times in seconds)
parameters.name: intervention_defer_rates[]

parameters.description: (in seconds)
parameters.name: intervention_defer_threshold

parameters.description: (Array of times in seconds)
parameters.name: intervention_rates

parameters.description: locale code (String)
parameters.name: locale

parameters.description: activate multi language support for messages (Boolean)
parameters.name: multi_lang

parameters.description: Name of the Dimelo Digital (String)
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: prohibit reusing old passwords (Boolean)
parameters.name: password_archivable_enabled

parameters.description: number of archived passwords
parameters.name: password_archivable_size

parameters.description: minimum character length
parameters.name: password_min_length

parameters.description: should contain at least 1 non alphanumeric char (Boolean)
parameters.name: password_non_word

parameters.description: should contain at least 1 number (Boolean)
parameters.name: password_numbers

parameters.description: disable password recovery by email (Boolean)
parameters.name: password_recovery_disabled

parameters.description: Enable push mode (Boolean)
parameters.name: push_enabled

parameters.description: Enable reply as any identity (Boolean)
parameters.name: reply_as_any_identity

parameters.description: Enable right to left support (Boolean)
parameters.name: rtl_support

parameters.description: ​Allow authors to ask approval of their messages (Boolean)
parameters.name: self_approval_required

parameters.description: Session timeout (in minutes)
parameters.name: session_timeout

parameters.description: Enable spellchecking (Boolean)
parameters.name: spellchecking

parameters.description: Defines the DD’s design (String)
parameters.name: style

parameters.description: Disable third-party services (tracking...) (Boolean)
parameters.name: third_party_services_disabled

parameters.description: Use the timezone endpoint to get the timezone name (String)
parameters.name: timezone

parameters.description: Track JS errors (Boolean)
parameters.name: track_js

parameters.description: Can be ‘demo’, ‘production’ or ‘archived’
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: Chat max response time (in seconds)
parameters.name: urgent_task_threshold

parameters.description: Experimental (Boolean)
parameters.name: use_system_font

get.description:
This method get all currently connected agents & their status.

Authorization​: only users that have the right to monitor the task view.

This method get the status of a connected agent. Returns a 404 if the user does not exist (not_found) or if he’s not connected (disconnected).

Authorization​: only users that have the right to monitor the task view.

put.description:
This method updates an agent's availability. Can be used to set either channels statuses OR custom  status. If both parameters are provided, ignores custom status.The status parameter​ **MUST** b​e either “away” or “available”.

Authorization​: only users that have the right to monitor the task view.

parameters.description: A hash of channel_id => availability (must contain all channels).
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: id of presence status (optional)
parameters.name: custom_status_id

get.description: This method renders tags ordered by name (ascending).

parameters.description: The record index to start. Default value is 0.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The max number of records to return. Default value is 30, max value is 150.
parameters.name: limit

post.description: This method creates a new tag. In case of success it renders the created tag, otherwise, it renders an error (422 HTTP code).

parameters.description: Tag name (mandatory).
parameters.name: name

delete.description:
This method destroys an existing tag. It renders tag itself. It renders a 404 if id is invalid.

Authorization​: only users that are able to destroy tags.

get.description: This method renders a tag from given id.
get.summary: Getting a tag from its id

put.description:
This method updates an existing tag from given attributes and renders it in case of success.

Authorization​: only users that are able to update tags.

parameters.description: Tag’s label.
parameters.name: name

get.description:
This method renders tasks ordered by priority (highest first) and then by creation date (latest first).

Authorization​: only users that can read tasks.

parameters.description: To filter tasks on given queue name (filters on the “global” queue by default).The most commonly used queues are: “global” (contains every task pending assignation), “workbin_{agent_id}” (contains every tasks assigned to the {agent_id} agent, “history” (contains every processed tasks), and “undelivered” (contains every undelivered tasks). If queue is set to “workbins” all the tasks currently in a workbin will be returned.
parameters.name: queue

parameters.description: To filter tasks on given channel id.
parameters.name: channel_id

parameters.description: To filter tasks on the step they’re currently in.
parameters.name: step

parameters.description: The record index to start. Default value is 0.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The max number of records to return. Default value is 30, max value is 150.
parameters.name: limit

get.description: This method renders a task from given id.
get.summary: Getting a task from its id

delete.description:
This method changes a task queue and renders it in case of success. Only accepts “undelivered” and special queue defined in topology (e.g. triage).

Authorization​: only users that have the right to monitor the task view.

parameters.description: Name of the queue task has to be moved in.
parameters.name: queue

delete.summary: Move a task to another queue

put.description:
This method transfers an existing task and renders it in case of success.

Authorization​: only users that have the right to monitor the task view.

parameters.description: List of agents to transfer the task to (multiple).
parameters.name: agent_ids

parameters.description: Force the transfer to the first agent in agent_ids if set. When bypass is used,
parameters.name: bypass

parameters.description: Filter agents receiving the task depending on their categories.
parameters.name: category_ids

parameters.description: Filter agents receiving the task depending on their spoken languages.
parameters.name: language

parameters.description: Filter agents receiving the task depending on their teams.
parameters.name: team_ids

parameters.description: Add a comment to the task.
parameters.name: comment

get.description: This method renders teams ordered by creation date (ascending).

parameters.description: The record index to start. Default value is 0.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The max number of records to return. Default value is 30, max value is 150.
parameters.name: limit

post.description: This method creates a new team. In case of success it renders the created tag, otherwise, it renders an error (422 HTTP code).

parameters.description: Team name.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: List of user id as leaders
parameters.name: leader_ids[]

parameters.description: List of user id as team members.
parameters.name: user_ids[]

delete.description: This method destroys an existing team. It renders the team itself. It renders a 404 if id is invalid.

parameters.description: ID of a category to recategorize (optional).
parameters.name: take_over_category_id

get.description: This method renders a team from given id.
get.summary: Getting a team from its id

put.description: This method updates an existing team from given attributes and renders it in case of success.

parameters.description: Team name.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: List of user id as leaders
parameters.name: leader_ids[]

parameters.description: List of user id as team members.
parameters.name: user_ids[]

get.description: This method renders time sheets ordered by active and label.

parameters.description: The record index to start. Default value is 0.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The max number of records to return. Default value is 30, max value is 150.
parameters.name: limit

post.description:
This method creates a time sheet. In case of success it renders the time sheet, otherwise, it renders an error (422 HTTP code).

Authorization​: only users that can create time sheet.

parameters.description: true or false, this field is used to enable/disable a time sheet.
parameters.name: active

parameters.description: The label of the time sheet.
parameters.name: label

parameters.description: An array containing id of each source using your time sheet.
parameters.name: source_ids

parameters.description: A string containing the first two letters of your country (example: "fr"/"en"/"es"), useful to bootstrap default holidays following to a country.
parameters.name: holidays_region

parameters.description: An array containing one or more hash of holidays, a holiday must contain a name (string) and a date (string), the date must be in a valid format, a valid format is a format corresponding to your domain’s locale).
parameters.name: holidays

parameters.description: this field define the time intervals of the day (in secs). An empty string means that there are no business hours on this day. For example: “a-b,c-d”: “a” is the beginning of the first interval of the day, “b” is the ending of the first interval of the day, “c” is the beginning of the second interval of the day, “d” is the ending of the second interval of the day
parameters.name: monday_hours

parameters.description: this field define the time intervals of the day (in secs). An empty string means that there are no business hours on this day. See `monday_hours` for the format.
parameters.name: tuesday_hours

parameters.description: this field define the time intervals of the day (in secs). An empty string means that there are no business hours on this day. See `monday_hours` for the format.
parameters.name: wednesday_hours

parameters.description: this field define the time intervals of the day (in secs). An empty string means that there are no business hours on this day. See `monday_hours` for the format.
parameters.name: thursday_hours

parameters.description: this field define the time intervals of the day (in secs). An empty string means that there are no business hours on this day. See `monday_hours` for the format.
parameters.name: friday_hours

parameters.description: this field define the time intervals of the day (in secs). An empty string means that there are no business hours on this day. See `monday_hours` for the format.
parameters.name: saturday_hours

parameters.description: this field define the time intervals of the day (in secs). An empty string means that there are no business hours on this day. See `monday_hours` for the format.
parameters.name: sunday_hours

delete.description: This method destroys an existing time sheet. It renders time sheet itself. It renders a 404 if id is invalid.

get.description:
This method renders a time sheet from given id.

Authorization​: only users that can see time sheets in administration section.
get.summary: Getting a time sheet from its id

put.description: This method updates an existing team from given attributes and renders it in case of success.

parameters.description: true or false, this field is used to enable/disable a time sheet.
parameters.name: active

parameters.description: The label of the time sheet.
parameters.name: label

parameters.description: An array containing id of each source using your time sheet.
parameters.name: source_ids[]

parameters.description: An array containing one or more hash of holidays, a holiday must contain a name (string) and a date (string), the date must be in a valid format, a valid format is a format corresponding to your domain’s locale).
parameters.name: holidays

parameters.description: this field define the time intervals of the day (in secs). An empty string means that there are no business hours on this day. For example: “a-b,c-d”: “a” is the beginning of the first interval of the day, “b” is the ending of the first interval of the day, “c” is the beginning of the second interval of the day, “d” is the ending of the second interval of the day
parameters.name: monday_hours

parameters.description: this field define the time intervals of the day (in secs). An empty string means that there are no business hours on this day. See `monday_hours` for the format.
parameters.name: tuesday_hours

parameters.description: this field define the time intervals of the day (in secs). An empty string means that there are no business hours on this day. See `monday_hours` for the format.
parameters.name: wednesday_hours

parameters.description: this field define the time intervals of the day (in secs). An empty string means that there are no business hours on this day. See `monday_hours` for the format.
parameters.name: thursday_hours

parameters.description: this field define the time intervals of the day (in secs). An empty string means that there are no business hours on this day. See `monday_hours` for the format.
parameters.name: friday_hours

parameters.description: this field define the time intervals of the day (in secs). An empty string means that there are no business hours on this day. See `monday_hours` for the format.
parameters.name: saturday_hours

parameters.description: this field define the time intervals of the day (in secs). An empty string means that there are no business hours on this day. See `monday_hours` for the format.
parameters.name: sunday_hours

get.description: This method renders all available timezones.

This method renders users ordered by creation date (descending).

Authorization​: only users that can view users. If the user affiliated to the token has the manage_users_of_my_teams permission, only the users belonging to at least one of the teams he’s the leader of will be returned.

parameters.description: To filter users on given email.
parameters.name: email

parameters.description: To filter users on given category id.
parameters.name: category_id

parameters.description: To filter users on given identity id.
parameters.name: identity_id

parameters.description: To filter users on given external id.
parameters.name: external_id

parameters.description: To filter users on given role id.
parameters.name: role_id

parameters.description: To filter users on given team id.
parameters.name: team_id

parameters.description: The record index to start. Default value is 0.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The max number of records to return. Default value is 30, max value is 150.
parameters.name: limit

post.description: This method creates a new user. In case of success it renders the created user, otherwise, it renders an error (422 HTTP code).

parameters.description: User list of category ids (multiple).
parameters.name: category_ids[]

parameters.description: User email (mandatory).
parameters.name: email

parameters.description: Whether the user is enabled or not (boolean).
parameters.name: enabled

parameters.description: User external id, used for SSO.
parameters.name: external_id

parameters.description: User firstname (mandatory).
parameters.name: firstname

parameters.description: User gender ("man" or "woman").
parameters.name: gender

parameters.description: User list of identity ids (multiple).
parameters.name: identity_ids[]

parameters.description: User lastname (mandatory).
parameters.name: lastname

parameters.description: Language for the user interface.
parameters.name: locale

parameters.description: User nickname.
parameters.name: nickname

parameters.description: User plain password (mandatory).
parameters.name: password

parameters.description: User role id (mandatory).
parameters.name: role_id

parameters.description: User list of team ids (multiple).
parameters.name: team_ids[]

parameters.description: Use the timezone endpoint to get the timezone name (String), default is empty for domain timezone.
parameters.name: timezone

parameters.description: List of locales corresponding to the languages spoken by the user (multiple).
parameters.name: spoken_languages[]

post.description:
This method invites a new user. In case of success it renders the created user, otherwise, it renders an error (422 HTTP code).

Authorization​: only users that can invite other users. If the user affiliated to the token has the manage_users_of_my_teams permission, the invited user will need to belong to at least one of the teams he’s the leader of. It will not be possible to assign the user to other teams.

parameters.description: User list of category ids (multiple).
parameters.name: category_ids

parameters.description: User email (mandatory).
parameters.name: email

parameters.description: Whether the user is enabled or not (boolean).
parameters.name: enabled

parameters.description: User external id.
parameters.name: external_id

parameters.description: User firstname (mandatory).
parameters.name: firstname

parameters.description: User gender ("man" or "woman").
parameters.name: gender

parameters.description: User list of identity ids (multiple).
parameters.name: identity_ids

parameters.description: User lastname (mandatory).
parameters.name: lastname

parameters.description: Language for the user interface.
parameters.name: locale

parameters.description: User nickname.
parameters.name: nickname

parameters.description: User role id (mandatory).
parameters.name: role_id

parameters.description: User list of team ids (multiple).
parameters.name: team_ids

parameters.description: Use the timezone endpoint to get the timezone name (String), default is empty for
parameters.name: timezone

parameters.description: List of locales corresponding to the languages spoken by the user (multiple).
parameters.name: spoken_languages

delete.description:
This method deletes the given user. In case of success it renders the deleted user, otherwise, it renders an error (422 HTTP code).

Authorization​: only users that can update users. The user affiliated to the token must have at least all the permissions of the other user. If the user affiliated to the token has the manage_users_of_my_teams permission, the deleted user will need to belong to at least one of the teams he’s the leader of.

get.description: This method renders a user from given id.
get.summary: Getting a user from its id

put.description:
This method updates users from given attributes and renders it in case of success.

Authorization​: only users that can update users. If the user affiliated to the token has the `manage_users_of_my_teams` permission, the updated user will need to belong to at least one of the teams he’s the leader of. The teams the user affiliated to the token is the leader of will be the only ones which can be added or removed.

parameters.description: User list of category ids (multiple).
parameters.name: category_ids[]

parameters.description: User email.
parameters.name: email

parameters.description: Whether the user is enabled or not (boolean).
parameters.name: enabled

parameters.description: User external id, used for SSO.
parameters.name: external_id

parameters.description: User firstname.
parameters.name: firstname

parameters.description: User gender ("man" or "woman").
parameters.name: gender

parameters.description: User list of identity ids (multiple).
parameters.name: identity_ids[]

parameters.description: User lastname.
parameters.name: lastname

parameters.description: Language for the user interface.
parameters.name: locale

parameters.description: User nickname.
parameters.name: nickname

parameters.description: User plain password.
parameters.name: password

parameters.description: User role id.
parameters.name: role_id

parameters.description: User list of team ids (multiple).
parameters.name: team_ids[]

parameters.description: Use the timezone endpoint to get the timezone name (String), default is empty for domain timezone.
parameters.name: timezone

parameters.description: List of locales corresponding to the languages spoken by the user (multiple).
parameters.name: spoken_languages[]

get.description:
This method renders webhooks ordered by active and staging_use (descending).

Authorization​: users having manage_api_access_tokens permission can see all webhooks / users don’t having the manage_api_access_tokens permission can see only the webhooks belonging to access token created by them.

parameters.description: Access token.
parameters.name: access_token

parameters.description: The record index to start. Default value is 0.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The max number of records to return. Default value is 30, max value is 150.
parameters.name: limit

post.description:
This method creates a webhook. In case of success it renders the webhook, otherwise, it renders an error (422 HTTP code).

Authorization​: All users having the manage_api_access_tokens permission or all users having an api access token.

parameters.description: Access token.
parameters.name: access_token

parameters.description: true or false, this field is used to enable/disable a webhook.
parameters.name: active

parameters.description: The label of the webhook.
parameters.name: label

parameters.description: true or false, this field is used to determine if a webhook will be run in staging
parameters.name: staging_use

parameters.description: The url of a webhook. This is used to determine the endpoint of your webhook, where
parameters.name: url

parameters.description: The token used in your webhook.
parameters.name: verify_token

parameters.description: The secret key that will be served as a ​`X-Dimelo-Secret​` header in every request.
parameters.name: secret

parameters.description: An array containing all the events that your webhook wants to subscribe.
parameters.name: registered_events[]

delete.description:
This method destroys an existing webhook. It renders webhook itself. It renders a 404 if id is invalid.

Authorization​: All users having the manage_api_access_tokens permission or all users having an api access token belonging to the webhook you’re deleting.

parameters.description: Access token.
parameters.name: access_token

get.description:
This method renders a webhook from given id.

Authorization​: users having manage_api_access_tokens permission can see any webhook / users don’t having the `manage_api_access_tokens` permission can see only the webhook in case the webhook is associated to an access token created by them.

parameters.description: Access token.
parameters.name: access_token

get.summary: Getting a webhook from its id

put.description:
This method updates an existing webhook from given attributes and renders it in case of success.

Authorization​: All users having the manage_api_access_tokens permission or all users having an api access token belonging to the webhook you’re updating.

parameters.description: Access token.
parameters.name: access_token

parameters.description: true or false, this field is used to enable/disable a webhook.
parameters.name: active

parameters.description: The label of the webhook.
parameters.name: label

parameters.description: true or false, this field is used to determine if a webhook will be run in staging
parameters.name: staging_use

parameters.description: The url of a webhook. This is used to determine the endpoint of your webhook, where
parameters.name: url

parameters.description: The token used in your webhook.
parameters.name: verify_token

parameters.description: The secret key that will be served as a ​`X-Dimelo-Secret​` header in every request.
parameters.name: secret

parameters.description: An array containing all the events that your webhook wants to subscribe.
parameters.name: registered_events[]
